snippet: The encounter between Israeli and Palestinian officials was kept at such a low profile that it was almost as if it had not happened at all.
abstract: Israeli and Palestinian officials meet for their second session in less than a week, after peace talks had been stalled for more than a year; encounter is kept at a low profile, attesting to the fragility of the contacts and apparent minimal expectations each side has for progress.

byline.contributor: Ranya Kadri contributed reporting from Amman, Jordan.

lead_paragraph: The encounter between Israeli and Palestinian officials was kept at such a low profile that it was almost as if it had not happened at all.

headline.seo: Israelis and Palestinians Discuss Peace Talks in Jordan
headline.main: Peace Talks Are Discussed in a Session in Jordan
headline.print_headline: Peace Talks Are Discussed In a Session In Jordan
